Posted By: TheWallinator74 (12/8/2013 9:32:07 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
New Art! I love when they reprint cards with new art, it makes it worthwhile to collect a play set again.. Who needs 20 copies of a card with the same artwork? They should make new art every time they do a reprint...   
  
Nightmare itself is such a staple mono black card. It is to Black as Serra Angel is to white. A classic, reliable "go to" card. When Nightmare hits the table, he should be a powerful 6/6 Flyer and only gets better as you drop more lands...  
  
Happy to see the reprint with new art. Good work Wizards!
posts.html:
New Art! I love when they reprint cards with new art, it makes it worthwhile to collect a play set again.. Who needs 20 copies of a card with the same artwork? They should make new art every time they do a reprint...

Nightmare itself is such a staple mono black card. It is to Black as Serra Angel is to white. A classic, reliable "go to" card. When Nightmare hits the table, he should be a powerful 6/6 Flyer and only gets better as you drop more lands...

Happy to see the reprint with new art. Good work Wizards!

Posted By: Reishyn (8/10/2013 12:36:17 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Maybe it's just me, but I feel like there are a couple of artworks that are quite creepy, but don't appear to be as much within the modern card frame. It's like the orderly frame can 'de-creep' the art.  
This printing would be such a case - I feel like this artwork would be more intimidating in the old frame.  
Likewise, I imagine [Abomination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=2084) for example would be less frightening (albeit just as disgusting) in a modern frame.
posts.html:
